sla_fields.PAYMENT TERM: Monthly in advance, by the 1st of each month
sla_fields.MAINTENANCE RESPONSIBILITIES - LESSOR: Responsible for ensuring vehicle is licensed, including valid Registration and PUC, and bearing all associated costs.
MAINTENANCE RESPONSIBILITIES - LESSEE: Responsible for general maintenance of the Vehicle.
Liable for costs associated with the repair of the Vehicle if damaged, regardless of cause.
Responsible for all running costs, including diesel/petrol, oil and other consumables.
Responsible for the on-going care of the Vehicle, to the same standard that a careful vehicle owner would display.
sla_fields.LESSEE RESPONSIBILITY FOR FINES: All fines resulting from traffic Law infringements (under the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988), overloading fines, and all fines imposed in relation to the use and parking of the Vehicle; payable on demand.
sla_fields.INSURANCE RESPONSIBILITIES - LESSOR: Responsible for taking out and maintaining comprehensive insurance on the Vehicle.
sla_fields.INSURANCE RESPONSIBILITIES - LESSEE: Liable for all excess payments (deductibles) that are required in relation to insurance claims.
sla_fields.VEHICLE RETURN CONDITION: Same condition as received on Commencement Date, fair wear and tear excluded.
sla_fields.BREACH REMEDY PERIOD: 10 days (or such shorter period as the Lessor may reasonably require)
sla_fields.IMMEDIATE TERMINATION THRESHOLD - BREACH: 3 or more breaches in a 12 calendar month period.
EARLY TERMINATION CONDITIONS - LESSEE BR: Failure to remedy a breach within the specified time period.
Lessee takes steps to place itself, or places itself, or is placed, in liquidation, whether provisionally or finally.
Lessee commits an act which would be an act of insolvency (as defined in the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016).
Business rescue proceedings begin in respect of the Lessee, as contemplated in the Companies Act, 2013.

Lessee proposes a general compromise with its creditors or any class of creditors or adopts or proposes a resolution for winding-up or any person applies for the winding-up of the Lessee or one of its major and essential suppliers or sub-contractors.
Lessee generally ceases to conduct its business or trade, or disposes of most or all of its material business assets to another person.
sla_fields.EARLY TERMINATION CONDITIONS - LESSOR BR: Failure to remedy a breach within the specified time period, coupled with a claim for damages if applicable.
sla_fields.NOTICE DELIVERY - REGISTERED POST: 7 days after the date on which the notice is posted.
